abstracts.cdata!:
The overall assessment of outcome of the
            Guyana Infrastructure Rehabilitation Project is
            unsatisfactory with unlikely sustainability, deficient
            supervision, and generally deficient borrower performance.
            Project development objectives have not been met, largely
            due to the borrowers failure to adopt institutional
            strengthening measures and key policy reforms during the
            implementation period. Among factors affecting the project
            are inefficient procurement, lack of capacity building, lack
            of monitoring capacity, and insufficient International
            Development Association (IDA) supervision. Recommendations
            for future projects include: the adoption of project
            implementation arrangements primarily focused on efficiently
            discharging its fiduciary and procurement responsibilities;
            the inclusion of assistance in developing institutional
            structure for comprehensive sector management: realistic
            assessment of borrowers supervision and monitoring capacity
            through institutional risk analyses; linking counterpart
            funding to fiscal or cost recovery mechanism reforms;
            ensuring the borrower is a full partner in policy reforms
            with a complete understanding of the interdependence of the
            reform program; and enhancing IDA supervision through
            appropriate staffing.

repnme.cdata!:
Guyana - Infrastructure Rehabilitation (Sea
            Defenses and Roads) Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The main objectives of the project are
            to:  (a) assist in the immediate repair and reconstuction of
            deteriorated critical sections of the sea defenses system;
            (b) improve the overall performance and efficiency of the
            management and operations of the transport sector; (c)
            facilitate agricultural, agro-industrial and mining
            production; and (d) help reduce the need for premature
            replacement of transport vehicles, spare parts and fuel
            imports. The project consists of:  (a) assistance for the
            repair of critical sections of the sea defenses system and
            the establishment of effective management, including the
            design and implementation of adequate cost recovery measures
            to provide reliable financing for operation and maintenance
            of the systems; the rehabilitation with minor alignment and
            subsequent maintenance of selected high priority main roads
            and bridges; (c) preventive maintenance of selected paved
            roads in the main network; (d) the institutional
            strengthening of the Ministry of Public Works,
            Communications and Regional Development for improving
            transport planning and project formulation, supervision of
            project implementation, and for the study and establishment
            of a national port authority; and (e) purchase of office
            equipment, airport fire fighting equipment and all-terrain vehicles.
